Submitted by: John C. Monk

Mervin A. Myers

May 26, 1919 - Jan. 24, 2010

SOUTH BEND - Mervin "Bud" A. Myers, 90, passed away at 11:30 p.m. on Sunday, January 24, 2010, in his residence. Mervin was born on May 26, 1919, in Plymouth, IN, to the late Aaron and Agnes (Vinall) Myers. On September 5, 1946, he married Catherine G. (Toth), who preceded him in death on October 11, 2005. He was also preceded in death by his two sisters, Mary Pershing and Julia Smith; his brother, John James; and by his half brother, Forest Myers. He is survived by his sister, Irene Flynn of Elkhart; and by his niece, Ramona Lute of South Bend; nephews, Frank, Gerald and Wayne Toth, and Rudy (Judy) Destics; and many cousins. Bud moved to South Bend in 1936 from Plymouth to take a job with the New York Pattern Company. He then worked for Bendix for 43 years before retiring in 1981. He was a member of Masonic Lodge #675 and the Scottish Rite. Bud was a good photographer and he loved John Deere tractors. Visitation will be from 4:00 p.m. to 8:00 p.m. on Wednesday, January 27, 2010, in ST. JOSEPH FUNERAL HOME, 824 S. Mayflower Road. A Masonic service will begin at 7:30 p.m. on Wednesday. Funeral services will be at 10:00 a.m. on January 28, 2010, in the funeral home. Burial will follow at Sacred Heart Cemetery. Memorial contributions may be made to Masonic Home, 690 State St., Franklin, IN 46131. For those who are unable to attend the Masonic service, condolences for the family may be made at www.sjfh.net.
